name: Matcher
comment: scheduled_test/unittest-matcher.expect Matchers must implement/extend the Matcher class. The base Matcher class has a generic implementation of scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.describeMismatch so this does not need to be provided unless a more clear description is required. The other two methods (scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.matches and scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.describe) must always be provided as they are highly matcher-specific.

matches.name: matches
matches.comment: This does the matching of the actual vs expected values. scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.matches.item is the actual value. scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.matches.matchState can be supplied and may be used to add details about the mismatch that are too costly to determine in scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.describeMismatch.

describe.name: describe
describe.comment: This builds a textual description of the matcher.

describeMismatch.name: describeMismatch
describeMismatch.comment: This builds a textual description of a specific mismatch. scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.describeMismatch.item is the value that was tested by scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.matches; scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.describeMismatch.matchState is the dart-core.Map that was passed to and supplemented by scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.matches with additional information about the mismact, and scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.describeMismatch.mismatchDescription is the scheduled_test/unittest-matcher.Description that is being built to decribe the mismatch. A few matchers make use of the scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.describeMismatch.verbose flag to provide detailed information that is not typically included but can be of help in diagnosing failures, such as stack traces.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of scheduled_test/scheduled_test.Matcher.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
